verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the day that Moses had fully set up the tabernacle, and had anointed it, and sanctified it, and all the instruments thereof, both the altar and all the vessels thereof, and had anointed them, and sanctified them;
verses.ct: On the day Moses finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed it and consecrated it along with all its equipment, including the altar and all its utensils — he anointed and consecrated everything.

verses.kjv: That the princes of Israel, heads of the house of their fathers, who were the princes of the tribes, and were over them that were numbered, offered:
verses.ct: Then the leaders of Israel — the heads of their ancestral families who served as tribal leaders and had supervised the census — brought their offerings.

verses.kjv: And they brought their offering before the LORD, six covered wagons, and twelve oxen; a wagon for two of the princes, and for each one an ox: and they brought them before the tabernacle.
verses.ct: They presented their gift to the LORD: 6 covered wagons and 12 oxen, with 1 wagon for every 2 leaders and 1 ox from each. They brought these in front of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Take it of them, that they may be to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation; and thou shalt give them unto the Levites, to every man according to his service.
verses.ct: "Accept these from them so they can be used for the work of the tent of meeting. Give them to the Levites, distributing them based on each group's responsibilities."

verses.kjv: And Moses took the wagons and the oxen, and gave them unto the Levites.
verses.ct: So Moses accepted the wagons and oxen and distributed them to the Levites.

verses.kjv: Two wagons and four oxen he gave unto the sons of Gershon, according to their service:
verses.ct: He gave 2 wagons and 4 oxen to the descendants of Gershon, matching their duties.

verses.kjv: And four wagons and eight oxen he gave unto the sons of Merari, according unto their service, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.ct: He gave 4 wagons and 8 oxen to the descendants of Merari, matching their duties under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

verses.kjv: But unto the sons of Kohath he gave none: because the service of the sanctuary belonging unto them was that they should bear upon their shoulders.
verses.ct: But he gave none to the descendants of Kohath, because their sacred responsibility required them to carry their items on their shoulders.

verses.kjv: And the princes offered for dedicating of the altar in the day that it was anointed, even the princes offered their offering before the altar.
verses.ct: The leaders also brought offerings for the dedication of the altar on the day it was anointed. They presented their offerings in front of the altar.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, They shall offer their offering, each prince on his day, for the dedicating of the altar.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Each leader is to present his offering on a separate day for the dedication of the altar."

verses.kjv: And he that offered his offering the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah:
verses.ct: The one who presented his offering on the 1st day was Nahshon son of Amminadab, from the tribe of Judah.

verses.kjv: And his offering was one silver charger, the weight thereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them were full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One spoon of ten shekels of gold, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Nahshon son of Amminadab.

verses.kjv: On the second day Nethaneel the son of Zuar, prince of Issachar, did offer:
verses.ct: On the 2nd day, Nethanel son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: He offered for his offering one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One spoon of gold of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Nethaneel the son of Zuar.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Nethanel son of Zuar.

verses.kjv: On the third day Eliab the son of Helon, prince of the children of Zebulun, did offer:
verses.ct: On the 3rd day, Eliab son of Helon, leader of the descendants of Zebulun, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Eliab son of Helon.

verses.kjv: On the fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur, prince of the children of Reuben, did offer:
verses.ct: On the 4th day, Elizur son of Shedeur, leader of the descendants of Reuben, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger of the weight of an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Elizur son of Shedeur.

verses.kjv: On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, prince of the children of Simeon, did offer:
verses.ct: On the 5th day, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai, leader of the descendants of Simeon, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

verses.kjv: On the sixth day Eliasaph the son of Deuel, prince of the children of Gad, offered:
verses.ct: On the 6th day, Eliasaph son of Deuel, leader of the descendants of Gad, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger of the weight of an hundred and thirty shekels, a silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:

verses.kjv: On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, prince of the children of Ephraim, offered:
verses.ct: On the 7th day, Elishama son of Ammihud, leader of the descendants of Ephraim, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Elishama son of Ammihud.

verses.kjv: On the eighth day offered Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, prince of the children of Manasseh:
verses.ct: On the 8th day, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur, leader of the descendants of Manasseh, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger of the weight of an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

verses.kjv: On the ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni, prince of the children of Benjamin, offered:
verses.ct: On the 9th day, Abidan son of Gideoni, leader of the descendants of Benjamin, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Abidan son of Gideoni.

verses.kjv: On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, prince of the children of Dan, offered:
verses.ct: On the 10th day, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai, leader of the descendants of Dan, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

verses.kjv: On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ocran, prince of the children of Asher, offered:
verses.ct: On the 11th day, Pagiel son of Ocran, leader of the descendants of Asher, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Pagiel the son of Ocran.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Pagiel son of Ocran.

verses.kjv: On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, prince of the children of Naphtali, offered:
verses.ct: On the 12th day, Ahira son of Enan, leader of the descendants of Naphtali, presented his offering.

verses.kjv: His offering was one silver charger, the weight whereof was an hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering:
verses.ct: His offering consisted of 1 silver platter weighing 130 shekels and 1 silver basin weighing 70 shekels, measured by the sanctuary standard. Both were filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering.

verses.kjv: One golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense:
verses.ct: He also brought 1 gold dish weighing 10 shekels, filled with incense.

verses.kjv: One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
verses.ct: For the burnt offering: 1 young bull, 1 ram, and 1 year-old male lamb.

verses.kjv: One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
verses.ct: For the sin offering: 1 male goat.

verses.kjv: And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.ct: For the peace offering: 2 oxen, 5 rams, 5 male goats, and 5 year-old male lambs. This was the offering from Ahira son of Enan.

verses.kjv: This was the dedication of the altar, in the day when it was anointed, by the princes of Israel: twelve chargers of silver, twelve silver bowls, twelve spoons of gold:
verses.ct: These were the total dedication gifts for the altar on the day it was anointed, given by the leaders of Israel: 12 silver platters, 12 silver basins, and 12 gold dishes.

verses.kjv: Each charger of silver weighing an hundred and thirty shekels, each bowl seventy: all the silver vessels weighed two thousand and four hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:
verses.ct: Each silver platter weighed 130 shekels and each basin weighed 70 shekels. The combined weight of all the silver items was 2,400 shekels by the sanctuary standard.

verses.kjv: The golden spoons were twelve, full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece, after the shekel of the sanctuary: all the gold of the spoons was an hundred and twenty shekels.
verses.ct: The 12 gold dishes, each filled with incense and each weighing 10 shekels by the sanctuary standard, had a combined gold weight of 120 shekels.

verses.kjv: All the oxen for the burnt offering were twelve bullocks, the rams twelve, the lambs of the first year twelve, with their meat offering: and the kids of the goats for sin offering twelve.
verses.ct: The total animals for the burnt offerings came to 12 bulls, 12 rams, and 12 year-old male lambs, along with their accompanying grain offerings. The total for sin offerings was 12 male goats.

verses.kjv: And all the oxen for the sacrifice of the peace offerings were twenty and four bullocks, the rams sixty, the he goats sixty, the lambs of the first year sixty. This was the dedication of the altar, after that it was anointed.
verses.ct: The total animals for the peace offerings came to 24 bulls, 60 rams, 60 male goats, and 60 year-old male lambs. These were the dedication offerings for the altar after it had been anointed.

verses.kjv: And when Moses was gone into the tabernacle of the congregation to speak with him, then he heard the voice of one speaking unto him from off the mercy seat that was upon the ark of testimony, from between the two cherubims: and he spake unto him.
verses.ct: Whenever Moses entered the tent of meeting to speak with God, he would hear the voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat on top of the ark of the testimony, from between the 2 cherubim. And God spoke to him.
